column39: USSR in a Tupolev ANT-25. This flight followed another similar historic flight over the pole when Valery Chkalov's crew of three ended up in Vancouver's Pearson Airfield earlier that same year. With these two flights
column40: the USSR earned two major milestones in the Fédération Aéronautique Internationale (FAI) flight records. In the early 1950s the fraternal group E Clampus Vitus and the Riverside County Department of Transportation commemorated the Gromov flight by erecting a stone marker on Cottonwood Avenue

column1: The city is served by the Riverside County Sheriff's Department. The city also maintains is own Police Department (San Jacinto Police Department).

The city of San Jacinto contracts for fire and paramedic services with the Riverside County Fire Department through a cooperative agreement with CAL FIRE. Fire Station 25 is also a CAL FIRE fire station which has a wildland fire engine.
The city is served by the San Jacinto Unified School District
column2: made up of 12 schools. There is one comprehensive high school
column6: Mountain View High School. There are 7 elementary schools and 3 middle schools in the city
column7: and one independent studies program on the Mountain View High School campus site. A 6-8 magnet school
column9: operates on the Clayton A. Record Elementary School campus

column1: The San Jacinto Valley Academy is a K-12 charter school. This school is IB (International Baccalaureate) accredited.
The San Jacinto Valley Cemetery District maintains the San Jacinto Valley Cemetery in the city. Notable burials include Danish cartoonist Henning Dahl Mikkelsen who created the strip Ferd'nand.
The Diamond Valley Arts Council (DVAC) maintains an arts complex called the Esplanade Arts Center (EAC)
column2: which features an art gallery
column4: and a performance space home to the Inland Stage Company (ISC).
